title: Commander Keen Funkadelic [EXTREME BETA version]
content:
[url=http://qsilver90.com/files/ckfunk.7z]ckfunk.7z[/url] [Extremely Beta]
Warning, this is EXTREME beta! (link doesn't work right now, check another post below)
-----Press SHIFT To Pogo-----

Anyone who remembers the old Q90 may recall that I kept promising to create a Goodbye Galaxy-esque engine in TGF/CnC. Well, this obviously never fully materialized as I kept putting it off.

HOWEVER, I have, in fact, finished the pogoing part. As Commander Keen Psychedelic was innovative in creating ledge-grabbing, I hereby dub my product Commander Keen Funkadelic, as it has a fully-functional pogoing engine in TGF. This will revolutionize the fangame world. I hope.-----------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.

title: Re: Commander Keen Funkadelic
content:
Looking forward to seeing that! And picking it apart in CnC.

Did you get my email?

title: Re: Commander Keen Funkadelic
content:
Heh, TGF. That's as ancient as KnP was two years ago. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Awaiting your file. I'm curious to see how you did some stuff.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Commander Keen Funkadelic
content:
I'll definitely get it uploaded today. I'd be warned, though, the "code" is a bit confusing.

I'm checking my email right now, by the way.-----------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.

title: Re: Commander Keen Funkadelic
content:
But what it basically entails is a group of events that causes you to move upwards, then a timer that causes you to fall down when you reach the top of the jump, then a thing that lets you jump higher when you hit CTRL and hit the ground at the same time.

It sounds simple but it took FOREVER!!!-----------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.

title: Re: Commander Keen Funkadelic
content:
It sounds super l33t. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

My experience with TGF is that, half the time, it won't do what it logically should be doing based on the events you put in. And a lot of the time the whole program crashes for no reason whatsoever. I commend you for your patience in using this handy but annoying program. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img] [img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: Commander Keen Funkadelic
content:
Thank you. This took an INSANE amount of time! It's still kinda buggy, and I do have a better version on my computer, but I lost my iPod cable so I can't transfer the good version over to a computer with high-speed internet.

I also decided to make up for the bugginess (and the horrible "level" I created that consists of a hand-drawn Garg-UFO hybrid and a red platform) by creating a cool intro featuring music by, you guessed it, Parliament-Funkadelic.

[I've added the link at the top - it may not work yet, but give it 5 minutes or so]

Edit: Now it won't upload. I'll do it again tomorrow, I promise!-----------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.

content:

This is only true for certain people with certain computers - it rarely crashed on mine. Also, the event system works fine most of the time, so I dunno what it is about that.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

content:

title: Re: Commander Keen Funkadelic
content:
Did someone say [url=http://files.commanderkeen.org/users/jimage/fangames/ckfunk.7z]mirror[/url]!?

You should ask Grafix about a CKFS account. In fact, someone should add it as a sticky somewhere...

Anyway, uh... good luck with that. You might want to dissect my little game, Das Viva, at [url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/spleen/download.html]Spleen Keen[/url], that I made for Unfleex's 24 Hours of Keen one year. It uses a couple of tricks you might want to investigate for making less ugly platform games in TGF.

Hmm... I should probably start moving that site to my new one someday soon.

Btw,

[hr]Instructions Restart App: F4 (works perfectly)
[hr][img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

title: Re: Commander Keen Funkadelic
content:
Shouldn't that be F2? All Click apps use F2, why change it to F4? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]
Okay, downloaded.

lol @ intro
D-d-d-did you use path movement for the enemy? Not even real AI?

The pogoing is actually pretty bad, since it's completely linear. Which means: no realistic gravity. Holding shift also makes the pogo system go nuts.

Gravity is broken: I can't fall off the ledge.

To be honest... I expected something better, but even my abandoned MMF engine seems better than this. Sorry to say, but you could have done better. This is not going to revolutionize the fangame world.

EDIT: lol, you already knew about most of what I said. So why didn't you fix it?____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
